entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 11:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Near Bankfull Water Levels On The Yukon River From Eagle To Circle This Weekend And Early Next Week... The Yukon River at Dawson, YT is very high and expected to rise through the weekend. Downstream at Eagle, near bankfull conditions are expected by Sunday night. This water will continue downstream early next week.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 11 at 3:38PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIAL FOR MODERATE TO HEAVY RAIN SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY IN EASTERN OKANOGAN COUNTY... Rain will spread into Northeastern Washington Sunday night and expand westward into Eastern Okanogan County. There is moderate to high uncertainty regarding rainfall amounts across eastern Okanogan County.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 10 at 3:42AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warmest temperatures of the season bring high river flows... The warmest temperatures of the season will enhance snowmelt in the mountains, resulting in high and increasing flows on area waterways. Snow monitoring sites in the high country have shown increasing snow melt, and warming snowpack temperatures, increasing the potential for a rapid snowmelt.
